captions.text:
l have but one question
foryou.

lt is foryourown good.
And ifyou can't make it,
l can make you.

[ Mr. Hand ]
We have a 20 question quiz
evey friday.

Your grade is the average
ofall your quizzes,

plus the midterm and final
which counts for one-third.

There will be no eating.
E-A-T-l-N-G.

No eating in this class!
[ Knocking ]

You get used to doing
your own business
on your own time.

and discuss U.S. Histoy
on your time, understand?

This guy's been stoned
since the third grade.

What class?
This is U.S. Histoy.

l see the globe
right there.

l get so lonely
when l hear that third
attendance bell ring...

and all my kids
are not here.

Sory, l'm late.
It'sjust like this new
schedule's totally confusing.

That's the name
they gave me.

l thinkyou know
where the front office is.

l have taken the time to
print up a complete schedule...

ofclass quizzes
and the chapters they cover.

Please pass them
to the desk behind you.

title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High (2/10) Movie CLIP - Spicoli Meets Mr. Hand (1982) HD

comments.author: Martin Hill

comments.text:
+Liam Ogren 
well Liam, you are obviously a bit young, and never had the experience of 
"smelling" a mimeograph paper copy - LOL.
but don't feel bad about being young, it just means you have more years of 
life remaining.
myself & most other OLD PEOPLE, would trade with you in a heart beat - LOL

commonly known "Photocopy" machines of today, were actually invented way 
back in 1959, but were very expensive & rarely used by many places, until 
the mid to latter 80's, when due to the advance of electronics technology & 
manufacturing, then Photocopy machines finally became much more affordable, 
& thus eventually took over as the primary method of making copies in 
businesses & schools, etc.

back in the early 80's (when this movie was made), as well as several 
decades before that, most copy machines were not "Photocopy" machines like 
what is commonly used today. They were often Mimeograph machines (or 
stencil duplicator), which was a low-cost printing press that works by 
forcing ink through a stencil onto paper. because the mimeograph was 
low-cost, it was widely used as the primary copy method for decades, 
especially in public schools on tight budgets.

when you held those freshly made copies in your hand, they would feel 
slightly "damp", due to the mimeograph fluid used by those copiers. and 
there was a strangely attractive aroma of methanol in the mimeograph fluid. 
that scent would typically remain present in newly made copies, for at 
least several hours after being printed out, until the paper completely 
dried out, after all the mimeograph fluid had completely evaporated away.

EVERYONE old enough to attend any schooling back in the 60's or 70's, 
remembers well, "smelling" their freshly copied paper sheets, that teachers 
often handed out during classes.  :)
comments.author: Doug in San Diego

comments.text:
@ jimmy the movie is funnier than shit and I remember it like yesterday , 
the characters were funnier than shit and remind me of people I went to 
highschool and elementary school with people just like this as we all have 
. However, teachers like Mr Hand are what I grew up with , some as strict , 
others strict just a little leaner but tough. What do we have today for 
teachers , nothing but Leftwing " friends for mentors / teachers " thus the 
a reason why kids are worse than they ever were. Some of those older 
teachers were leftiwngers but many still demanded " results " , " results " 
is a dirty word , oppressive , mentally distressing si why requite 
competition and results anymore ! Thus Jeff Spicoli and his types are no 
longer the " few " they are now the " many " , " Fuck you teach , fuck you 
school , duck you society !
The movie is a cult classic and I love it but at some point enough is 
enough , reality isn't a fucking joke its " real " ! Unless you want the 
government taking care of you , go to school , even if you are average  
learn something and realize that there is more to learn in life , laziness 
and apathy are detrimental . Jeff Spicoli is the clown and the guy that 
made us feel good and nothing wrong with that , but this is the way kids 
are right now !
